title: Leicester chairman Aiyawatt Srivaddhanaprabha thanks fans for their tributes to father Vichai
text:
Leicester chairman Aiyawatt Srivaddhanaprabha has thanked the club's supporters for their tributes on the first anniversary of his father's death.

Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha was killed on October 27 last year along with two members of his staff, Nusara Suknamai and Kaveporn Punpare, and two pilots and partners, Izabela Lechowicz and Eric Swaffer, when his helicopter crashed close to the King Power Stadium, shortly after it had taken off following Leicester's 1-1 draw with West Ham.

Supporters paid their respects during the 2-1 win over Burnley on October 19, and the record 9-0 win at Southampton last Friday, while the club opened a memorial garden on Sunday, on the site of the accident.

Chairman Aiyawatt Srivaddhanaprabha has thanked the 'Leicester City family' for their support on the first anniversary of his father Vichai's death

'Top' watches Leicester's Premier League match against Burnley earlier this month

In an open letter to supporters, Top wrote: 'I watched the game at Southampton from Thailand at 2am and it was perfect. Not just the win and not just the score, but the whole night.

'My father always taught me to fight for what is important, to keep going and he always wanted Leicester to do the same.

'It was the only thing he ever asked for – that we fight together and give our best until the very last minute. I was watching with so much pride in my heart.

Aiyawatt and Vichai lift the Premier League trophy following Leicester's incredible 2016 win

A memorial garden has been opened for Vichai and the other victims of the helicopter crash

'On Sunday, my family and I paid our respects to my father and all those we lost a year ago. After, I received photographs and videos from the memorial garden in Leicester and read so many messages and tributes.

'It is a garden my father would have loved and I am looking forward to seeing it when I come for the Arsenal match next month.

'My father meant so much to so many people and I hope the garden can be a place where everyone can find some peace.

'I want to say thank you to the Leicester City family – our supporters and our community. It means so much to me and to my family.'

Leicester fans hold up scarves commemorating Vichai during their 9-0 win at Southampton
description: Leicester chairman Aiyawatt Srivaddhanaprabha has thanked the club's supporters for their tributes on the first anniversary of his father's death.
